position: B.S. Computer Science + B.S. Interactive Media and Game Development in progress
description: Class of 2023. Majoring in Computer Science and Interactive Media and Game Development.

Worked with a team of interns to create WhyMow.com with Googleâ€™s Angular and Firebase. I learned a lot about web development from this internship. Before, I was making simple HTML and CSS pages with little to no JavaScript. John showed me how I can use TypeScript to better organize JavaScript and how to use a JavaScript framework with a "serverless" backend to power good-looking websites that are fast while still having fancy animations and large, single-page operations.

Working with a team to create and maintain websites with WordPress, Angular, Flask, MySQL, and many other technologies for clients. My main job is to convert the clients ideas into code. I mostly work with WordPress as it gives the client an easy to use dashboard and simple page editing capabilities, but I have worked with Angular and Flask to create very specific pages that would have been much more complex if I had to make them with PHP in WordPress. In this position, I have learned a lot about CSS and the design of websites as well as how to efficiently store and retrieve data from relational and non-relational databases such as MySQL and MongoDB using REST APIs and server rendering.
